Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery convex and ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394904) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394904)
